section.audio_text: Speed stability augmentation is provided by the Speed Trim function in the Speed Trim System. It is primarily designed to improve flight characteristics during operation with a low gross weight, aft center of gravity, and high thrust when the autopilot is not engaged.

The Speed Trim function returns the airplane to a trimmed airspeed by commanding the stabilizer in a direction opposite the airspeed change. This increases control column forces to encourage return to the trimmed airspeed. As the airplane returns to its trimmed airspeed, the stabilizer trim inputs are reversed.
